name: Introductory Physics
description: This course provides students with an introduction to the basic concepts of physics. Topics covered include mechanics, waves, electricity, magnetism, and thermodynamics.

name: General Chemistry
description: This course introduces students to the foundational concepts and principles of chemistry. Topics covered include atomic structure, chemical bonding, stoichiometry, thermodynamics, and chemical reactions.

name: Calculus I
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts of calculus. Topics covered include limits, derivatives, integrals, and applications of calculus to physics and engineering problems.

name: Optics
description: This course provides students with an introduction to the principles and applications of optics. Topics covered include the nature of light, reflection, refraction, diffraction, interference, polarization, and optical instruments.

name: Electricity and Magnetism
description: This course covers the principles of electricity and magnetism. Topics include electric and magnetic fields, electromagnetic waves, electric circuits, and applications of electricity and magnetism in modern technology.

name: Modern Physics
description: This course covers the principles of modern physics. Topics include special relativity, quantum mechanics, atomic physics, nuclear physics, and particle physics.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course covers the principles of quantum mechanics. Topics include wave-particle duality, uncertainty principle, Schr√∂dinger equation, quantum states, and applications of quantum mechanics in modern technology.
